section.marginalnote: Milk transfers from farm holding tanks

subsection.subsectiontext: No person shall transfer milk from a farm holding tank other than

paragraph.paragraphtext: a tank milk receiver licensee or an inspector, and
in accordance with the procedures set out in subsection (2).

subsection.subsectiontext: A person who transfers milk from a farm holding tank to a tank truck shall

paragraph.paragraphtext: immediately upon entering the milk house, wash and dry his hands before handling or touching any of the equipment,
examine the milk in the farm holding tank for undesirable odours and for physical defects or other objectionable matter,
if the agitator in the farm holding tank is running when he enters the milk house

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: record the time and permit agitation to continue for at least an additional 5 minutes, and
immediately take a sample of the milk when the agitation stops, as required by paragraphs (h), (i) and (j),

paragraph.paragraphtext: if the agitator is not running when he enters the milk house and if the milk has passed the preliminary examination required under paragraph (b), take a reading,
before any reading is taken,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: ensure that the measuring rod is the correct one for that holding tank,
remove the measuring rod from the milk, cleanse and rinse it with hot water and thoroughly dry it with a clean tissue or paper towel,
ensure that the milk surface is completely still and remains so during the taking of the reading,
reinsert the measuring rod carefully and slowly, taking care not to penetrate foam,
ensure that the rod is seated properly,
give the head of the rod a light tap and remove hand momentarily,
withdraw the measuring rod slowly so that any disturbance of the milk surface is minimized in case a remeasurement is necessary, and
read the measurement of the milk as indicated by the milk surface line to the nearest one thirty-second of an inch or the nearest millimetre without interpolating,

paragraph.paragraphtext: record the measurement of the milk in terms of the measuring rod or gauge reading and, by reference to the conversion chart posted on the milk house wall, record the corresponding volume in litres,
immediately following the recording of the measurement, take and record the temperature of the milk in the farm holding tank,

after the milk has been agitated for a least 5 minutes in the farm holding tank, take a sample of not less than 100 ml obtained in approximately proportionate amounts from several locations within the tank using a sanitized dipper that has been rinsed in the milk prior to sampling,
add the sample to an approved clearly identified pre-sanitized single use container,
tightly close the sample container,
take such other samples as may be required by an inspector or the dairy plant licensee to whom the milk is consigned,
enter in triplicate on record forms the following information:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the measurement and volume recorded;
the name or adequate identification of the owner of the milk;
the name of the dairy plant licensee purchasing the milk;
the time and date of pickup;
the temperature of the milk;
the signature of the tank milk receiver;
where appropriate, remarks concerning any unusual occurrence or situation during the course of the pickup,

paragraph.paragraphtext: leave the milk in the farm holding tank where, in his opinion, that milk

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: is abnormal in odour, contains excessive sediment, objectionable matter or physical defects of any kind, or is not consistent with good quality milk, and
would, if transferred into the tank truck, be of detriment to the milk in the tank truck or to subsequent transfers of other milk into the tank truck,

paragraph.paragraphtext: issue a rejection slip in triplicate where he leaves milk in the farm holding tank in compliance with paragraph (m), stating on the slip the reasons for rejection, leaving the original copy with the owner, the second copy with the dairy plant licensee and keeping the third copy available for at least 3 months for examination by an inspector,
after transferring the milk from the farm holding tank and disconnecting the hose

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: rinse the inner surfaces of all parts of the farm holding tank with cold or lukewarm water,
remove litter of any kind resulting from the milk pickup,
wash and rinse down the drain any spillages that are on the outer surface of the holding tank or the milk house floor,

paragraph.paragraphtext: switch off the lights, and the compressor in the case of a direct expansion farm holding tank, when leaving the milk house and close the door and the hose port of the milk house,

carefully store and transport samples, maintaining them at a temperature between freezing point and 4° C until they are delivered to a responsible person at the dairy plant to which the milk is consigned, and
where samples of the milk are not obtained, notify the producer of the milk and the management of the dairy plant to which the milk is consigned, giving the reasons for not obtaining samples.

Table cream includes any lot of cream that is

paragraph.paragraphtext: non-frozen,
sweet and clean in flavour and odour, and

subsection.subsectiontext: The acidity of table cream shall not be more than 17/100 of 1% at the time of grading at the dairy plant.

section.marginalnote: Procedure for dealing with penalties for infractions

subsection.subsectiontext: Where a producer is subject to a penalty under this Part, the dairy plant licensee to whom the producer supplies milk shall deduct that penalty from the money due from him to the producer and pay it to the treasurer of the fund committee for payment into the Dairy Products Promotional Fund under section 124 (2) (c) (ii), not later than the 19th day of the month following that for which the penalty was deducted.

All monies standing to the credit of the bank trust account established and maintained by the treasurer under section 124 (2) (a) shall constitute the promotion fund.

subsection.subsectiontext: The treasurer shall not make any payment out of the promotion fund until that payment is approved by the promotion fund committee.
The treasurer shall pay out of the promotion fund each payment that is approved by the promotion fund committee within a reasonable time of its approval.
Payments out of the promotion fund may be made for

paragraph.paragraphtext: any matter arising under section 123, and
accounts that are approved under section 125.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 18/2003, s. (a).]

subsection.subsectiontext: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 18/2003, s. (a).]

An auditor shall, each year, audit the bank trust accounts, books, other accounts and records relating to the promotion fund and, where the minister is of the opinion that the auditor's report for any year is unsatisfactory in any respect, a further audit shall be made by a different auditor.

At the conclusion of each fiscal year, the treasurer shall prepare a statement respecting the receipts and disbursements of the promotion fund committee making it available to all vendors and through them to all contributing producers.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 18/2003, s. (a).]
